oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Fabrication of a Glucose Biosensor Based on Citric Acid Assisted Cobalt Ferrite Magnetic Nanoparticles
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KRISHNA, R
TITUS, E
CHANDRA, S
BARDHAN, NK
KRISHNA, R

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Citric Acid
Cobalt Ferrite
Glucose Biosensor
Amperometry
HYDROGEN-PEROXIDE

AMPEROMETRIC DETECTION

REDUCTION

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A novel and practical glucose biosensor was fabricated with immobilization of Glucose oxidase (GOx) enzyme on the surface of citric acid (CA) assisted cobalt ferrite (CF) magnetic nanoparticles (MNPs). This innovative sensor was constructed with glassy carbon electrode which is represented as (GOx)/CA-CF/(GCE). An explicit high negative zeta potential value (-22.4 mV at pH 7.0) was observed on the surface of CA-CF MNPs. Our sensor works on the principle of detection of H2O2 which is produced by the enzymatic oxidation of glucose to gluconic acid. This sensor has tremendous potential for application in glucose biosensing due to the higher sensitivity 2.5 mu A/cm(2)-mM and substantial increment of the anodic peak current from 0.2 mu A to 10.5 mu A.
